page.description: Get a property array order list.
page.syntax: Array_Order as C = property_order( field as c , values as c )

argument.name: Array_Order
argument.description: The reordered sequence of array elements.

argument.name: field
argument.description: The name of the property to use for reordering.

argument.name: values
argument.description: The values of the property to use for reordering.

page.discussion: The <ARRAY>.PROPERTY_ORDER() method creates a list containing the sequence of reordered array elements. Use the <ARRAY>.REORDER() method to resequence the array.

section.title: Example
section.description: Create an array named arr and populate it with name and desc properties.
section.example: dim data as C data = <<%str% One|first one Two|second one Three|third one %str% dim arr[3] as P arr.initialize_properties("name|desc", data) ? arr = +[1]. +[2]. +[3].

section.description: Define an arbitrary order for the name property in the array.
section.example: dim refList as C refList = comma_to_crlf("Two,One,Three") ? reflist = Two One Three

section.description: Create a string that defines how the array should be reordered.
Now sort the array based on this new order.
section.example: arr.reorder(ord) ? arr.dump_properties("name|desc") = Two|second one One|first one Three|third one
